questions.text: A 35-year-old male patient comes to the clinic complaining of a hypopigmented scaly patch on his upper back as shown in the picture below, that has been present for the past 3 months. He denies any associated itching, pain, or other symptoms. On physical examination, the patch is non-tender, and has well-defined borders. There are no similar lesions elsewhere on his body. The rest of the examination is unremarkable. What is the most appropriate next step in the evaluation of this patient?
Which of the following poison is not correctly paired with its antidotes?

A woman is scheduled to undergo a laparoscopic hysterectomy and seeks information about its potential drawbacks from the surgeon. What are the disadvantages of laparoscopic surgery compared to open surgery?

options.label: B
options.text: Not knowing the extent of thermal burns

questions.correct_answer: B. Not knowing the extent of thermal burns
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Not knowing the extent of thermal burns

questions.text: During 2009 pandemic, which strain of influenza virus was responsible for the widespread outbreak affecting populations worldwide?
Which of the following helminthic infections that is commonly transmitted by soil, is characterized by the egg in stool as shown in the image below?

A 52-year-old man presents to the clinic with a non-healing ulcer below the left eyelid that has been present for several months, as shown below. He reports occasional bleeding from the ulcer, especially when he accidentally scratches it. On examination, the ulcer is pearly in appearance with a rolled border, and there are visible telangiectasias on the surface. The lesion measures approximately 1 cm in diameter. The remainder of his examination is unremarkable, and he has no other health concerns. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The test kit shown in the image below works on the principle of:
What determines the fate of the Mullerian duct?

A 7-year-old girl from Bihar presented with pain in the RUQ, lump in the abdomen. Investigation revealed conjugated hyper-bilirubinemia. USG abdomen showed dilated CBD of 6 mm. What will be your next investigation?

A 45-year-old male patient presented to the OPD with painful swelling over his calf. He was diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis & was started on a new drug. After 2 days, he presented with the given finding. Which of the following drugs is implicated in causing the given condition?

A patient presents with complaints of numbness and reduced sensation in the lower abdominal region. Upon examination, you notice a distinct area of decreased sensation extending horizontally across the midline of the abdomen, as marked in the image below. Which dermatome is likely to be affected?

A 55-year-old male presents to the nephrology clinic for a routine check-up of his renal function. He has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes, which are known risk factors for kidney disease. The doctor decides to assess his renal clearance of specific substances to monitor his kidney function. Identify the correctly matched pair of substances with their renal clearance from the graph given below:

options.label: A
options.text: A - Glucose, B - PAH, C - Bicarbonate and D - Inulin

options.label: B
options.text: A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin and D - PAH

options.label: C
options.text: A - PAH, B - Inulin, C - Glucose and D - Bicarbonate

options.label: D
options.text: A - Inulin, B - Glucose, C - Bicarbonate and D – PAH

questions.correct_answer: B. A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin and D - PAH
questions.explanation: Ans. B. A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin and D - PAH

questions.text: A researcher investigated the relationship between C-reactive protein (CRP) values and the risk of myocardial infarction (MI) or stroke. The study group was divided into quintiles, and the table below displays the results. Based on the findings, which statement is true regarding the association between CRP values and the risk of myocardial infarction/stroke?

options.label: A
options.text: CRP has no association with risk of MI/stroke

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in CRP decreases the risk of MI/stroke

options.label: D
options.text: In quintile 1, there is no risk of MI/stroke

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Strode

questions.text: A 28-year-old female is currently being assessed for multiple instances of recurrent pregnancy losses. Upon performing an ultrasound, there is a suspicion of a Mullerian anomaly. What would be the most effective method to verify this suspicion?

A 35-year-old female has presented to the OPD with the following hand findings. She is started on Methotrexate for the same. Which of the following statements describe the correct mechanism of action of this drug in this condition?

A 10-year-old school child visits a primary care clinic for routine vaccinations as per the immunization program. The healthcare provider reviews the child's immunization records and plans to administer the appropriate vaccine to ensure the child's protection against preventable diseases. Which specific vaccine is recommended to be given during this visit?
Name the parasite whose microfilaria have a sheath with no nuclei at the tail end.
The most consistent and persistent feature of bladder carcinoma is:

2-year-old child was brought to the paediatric OPD with complaints of fever for a week duration with normal physical examination. A urine screening test was performed to rule out any inborn error of metabolism in the child and the results were, Benedict’s test - positive Blood Glucose - 110 mg % Bial’s test - positive Urine glucose, fructose and galactose – Negative. What is your most probable diagnosis?
Which statement refers best to the criteria for starting an urban community health center?

options.label: A
options.text: Caters to a population of 1-1.5 lakh

options.label: B
options.text: Referral center for 2- 3 primary health centers

options.label: C
options.text: No sub-district and district hospitals present in the area

options.label: D
options.text: Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities

questions.correct_answer: D. Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities

questions.text: Which of the following gene mutation is associated with radiation induced breast cancers?

A 55-year-old male presents with severe backache for 10 days and urinary incontinence with a history of intervertebral lumbar disc prolapse. There is no H/o fever or weight loss. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old presents with painful hematuria. USG KUB reveals a 10 mm renal pelvic stone. Which of the following findings will not permit Extra-corporeal shock wave lithotripsy to be done for this patient?
A 14-year-old boy presents with a history of vomiting within 3 hours of consumption of food at a party. Which of the following organism is most likely to cause these symptoms?

A woman arrives at the outpatient department with a history of 6 weeks of not having her menstrual periods (amenorrhea). She complains of vaginal bleeding and experiences mild abdominal pain. A urine pregnancy test confirms she is pregnant, and her human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) level is measured at 2800 IU/L. Further investigation reveals the presence of a 3 x 2 cm mass on the left adnexa. Fortunately, her vital signs are stable. How would you approach the management of this patient?

A patient presents with a clean-cut injury that is not lacerated. The patient reports having received a tetanus vaccination about 10 years ago. What is the appropriate course of action for the next step?

A 28-year-old patient presents with complaints of memory difficulties and difficulty forming new memories. Upon examination, you notice bilateral damage to a certain structure in the brain that is involved in memory consolidation and recall. The treating doctor noted the following structure, which was damaged and led to the above signs and symptoms. Identify the structure marked in the image below?

A 7-year-old boy presents to OPD with pain in the left ear which was of sudden onset and associated with hardness of hearing. On examination, a red, bulged tympanic membrane was found. What is the next step in the management of this child?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate incision and drainage of pus in the middle ear

questions.text: An unimmunized 2-year-old child presented with coryza, conjunctivitis, and bluish-white spots in his buccal mucosa near the lower molar teeth. A day later, he developed a maculopapular rash on the face and neck. What is the nature of the causative virus?
A 13-year-old boy presents to trauma centre after skid injury, and he is unable to pass urine with blood at meatus. What is the next step?

Which nerve is the most likely candidate for involvement in this scenario, potentially explaining the patient's neurological symptoms?
Pulsatile osteolytic secondaries are associated with which cancer?
questions.correct_answer: B. Clear Cell Carcinoma of Kidney
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Clear Cell Carcinoma of Kidney

questions.text: You are working in a primary health center (PHC) situated in a high seismic zone. Which of the following will you do as part of preparedness for an emergency? Disaster preparedness by making sure all financial and other resources is available Increase public awareness through campaigns and loudspeakers Conduct a simulation for the disaster and assess the response Follow instructions given over the phone or radio by higher officials
A newly joined teacher develops rice water stools. The causative agent acts on which of the following receptors?
Which of the following is the predominant pathogen to infect the renal transplant recipients in the period around 1 to 4 months following the transplantation?
Assertion : Decompression surgery is needed with progressive neurological difficulty in Pott’s spine. Reason : Even after completion of ATT there can be neurological abnormalities.

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion.

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the Assertion.

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true/correct statement but the Reason is independently an incorrect/false statement.

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false/incorrect statement but the reason is independently a true/correct statement.

questions.correct_answer: B. Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the Assertion.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the Assertion

The type of enzyme inhibition in which Succinate dehydrogenase reaction is inhibited by m alonate is an example of:
A 35-year-old chronic hypertensive woman visits the outpatient department for pre conceptional counselling. Which of the following anti-hypertensive should not be given to her?

A 5-year-old male presents to the emergency department with sudden onset weakness and sensory changes in his lower extremities and one side of his body. Based on the clinical history and examination findings, John Doe is diagnosed with Brown-Sequard syndrome. What is the true statement about Brown-Sequard syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Fine touch lost on the opposite side

options.label: B
options.text: Pain and temperature lost on the same side

options.label: C
options.text: Pain and temperature loss on the opposite side

options.label: D
options.text: Only pain lost on the same side

questions.correct_answer: C. Pain and temperature loss on the opposite side
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Pain and temperature loss on the opposite side

questions.text: A 50-year-old male arrived at the clinic with a complaint of gradual loss of clear vision, sensitivity to light, and discomfort in his eye. During the examination, the doctor observed redness in the conjunctiva, a partially dilated pupil, and a shallow anterior chamber in his right eye. Despite receiving medical and surgical treatment for his condition, there was no noticeable improvement. The subsequent procedure introduced a specialized device designed to facilitate drainage. Identify the device?

A 40-year-old patient diagnosed with diabetes visited with complaints of a squint. During examination, it was noted that the secondary deviation exceeded the primary deviation. The forced duction test yielded negative results. Based on these findings, what type of squint is most probable in this patient?
Which of the following statements regarding the immunoglobulins is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The only heat labile antibody is IgA

options.label: B
options.text: IgM is the primary antibody produced in the secondary immune response

options.label: C
options.text: IgG is the only antibody which takes the secretory component from the epithelium

options.label: D
options.text: IgM and IgD serve a B-cell surface receptors

questions.correct_answer: D. IgM and IgD serve a B-cell surface receptors
questions.explanation: Ans. D. IgM and IgD serve a B-cell surface receptors.

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct formula for calculation of the maintenance dose rate of a drug?

Ans. A. Wiskott Aldrich syndrome

questions.text: A 60-year-old female came in with post-menopausal bleeding. Ultrasonography findings displayed an image of a mass with a feeding vessel. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 35-year-old primigravida who conceived after in-vitro fertilization therapy came for an antenatal checkup at 38 weeks of gestation. Her obstetric history indicates that she is carrying DCDA twins. During examination, it was observed that the first twin is in a breech position, and the woman's blood pressure measured greater than 140/90 mm Hg on two occasions, along with grade 1+ proteinuria. What should be the next course of action?

options.label: A
options.text: Monitor BP and terminate pregnancy if BP rises

options.label: C
options.text: Terminate pregnancy at 40 weeks of gestation

questions.text: Arrange the following anaesthetic agents on the basis of their potency? Nitrous oxide Halothane Isoflurane Methoxyflurane
questions.correct_answer: A. Methoxyflurane > Halothane > Isoflurane > Nitrous oxide
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Methoxyflurane > Halothane > Isoflurane > Nitrous oxide

questions.text: Match the following clinical condition with their respective medical kits?
A 25-year-old male presented to the clinic with a complaint of the feeling of insects crawling under the skin. Which of the following drug abuse can cause the symptoms of this patient?

A 25-year-old male patient with the history of angina has presented to the OPD. He is prescribed a drug which acts by inhibiting the late sodium current in the heart. Which of the following drugs is being prescribed?

A patient with rheumatoid arthritis is being treated with methotrexate and low-dose corticosteroids for the past 4 months. However, the disease is still progressing. What would be your recommendation for the further management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Stop oral methotrexate and start parenteral methotrexate

questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Add sulfasalazine and hydroxychloroquine

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/Rheumatoid arthritis/ Chap 358

options.label: B
options.text: Green labels are for those who need to be transported on priority

questions.correct_answer: D. Transmitted in classical Mendelian fashion

questions.explanation: Ans. D. Drug D is more potent than drugs A, B, & C, but less efficacious than drugs A & B, and equally efficacious as drug C

questions.text: A patient presents with frequent urination, nocturia, and enuresis. 24-hour urine volume was measured and recorded to be 7 liters. The urine osmolarity was 260 mOsm/L. ADH assay was performed and the recorded values were reported as 0.8 pg/mL. An MRI of the brain was performed and T1 weighted indicated the absence of the bright spot. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A farmer presents to the emergency department with pinpoint pupil, diarrhea, sweating, excessive lacrimation, salivation and garlic odour. On examination there is bradycardia and BP is 80/60 mm Hg pulse rate is 56/min and his plasma cholinesterase level was 52 U/mL. Which of the following is antidote for treatment of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Police not under rank of sub inspector

questions.text: A chest X-ray showing a child with a widened mediastinum and a loss of the aortic knob. What is the most likely diagnosis based on the image findings?
The observed myocardial stunning pattern does not match the ECG findings of a patient. What is the probable diagnosis?
According to the WHO, what percentage of immunization coverage is needed for eradication of measles?

A 40-year-old patient arrives at the clinic reporting an intense, pulsating headache on one side of their head, accompanied by sensitivity to light and excessive tearing from the affected eye. The patient also mentions experiencing sharp pain on one side of their face when clenching their teeth. During the examination, you observe that the pupillary, light, and accommodation reflexes are functioning normally. Which of the labelled nerves in the provided image is likely to be implicated in this clinical scenario, contributing to the described symptoms and findings?
A patient was prescribed escitalopram. Which of the following adverse effect is the least likely?

A 30-year-old woman presents with a unilateral throbbing headache associated with nausea and vomiting. She reports that she had multiple episodes in the past and her headache lasts for 1-2 days. She also says that her headache is aggravated by bright light and is relieved when she sits in a dark room. Which of the following drugs can be used to prevent these episodes?
In a particular community, the usual number of reported dengue cases ranges from 40 to 50 per week. However, this week, there were 48 reported cases. How would this situation be classified?

A 65-year-old male with a history of hypertension and coronary artery disease presents to the emergency room with complaints of shortness of breath and chest pain. On physical examination, his vital signs are stable, but he appears to be in respiratory distress. An electrocardiogram (ECG) shows low voltage QRS complexes and electrical alternans. CXR was performed which is shown here. What is the likely finding on auscultation?

options.label: B
options.text: Dull note on right lower chest

options.label: D
options.text: Hyper-resonant note on right lower chest

questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Pericardial friction rub

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Grainger & Allison’s Diagnostic Radiology Essentials, Second Edition, Page No 36

questions.text: In a case involving a 34-year-old man with fever and significant splenomegaly, the spleen was found to measure 15 cm and displayed an oblique orientation when assessed from the right iliac fossa. What anatomical structure serves to hinder the spleen's direct downward and vertical displacement?
Thrombosis of posterior inferior cerebellar artery causes?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Lateral Medullary syndrome.

questions.text: A 9-month-old infant is unable to sit without support and does not respond to their name. What should be the next step in the evaluation?

options.label: A
options.text: Reassure the parents as these findings are within normal range.

options.label: B
options.text: Refer the infant to early intervention services.

options.label: C
options.text: Order a brain MRI to rule out neurological issues.

options.label: D
options.text: Start the infant on a speech therapy program.

questions.correct_answer: B. Refer the infant to early intervention services.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Refer the infant to early intervention services.

However, the condition recently exacerbated, leading to multiple episodes of bowel obstruction refractory to conservative management. questions.text: A 30-year-old male presented to the OPD with severe abdominal cramps, diarrhea with blood and mucus. He reported that he had not travelled recently anywhere. questions.explanation: Ans. C. Flask shaped Ulcers – Entamoeba histolytica

questions.text: After fitting the pessary, what is the initial step to ensure proper retention of the pessary?

options.label: A
options.text: Asking the patient to void and see if the pessary is in place

options.label: B
options.text: Seeing if the patient feels any discomfort, which means that the pessary is retained

options.label: C
options.text: Asking the patient to perform the Valsalva maneuver and see if the pessary is in place

options.label: D
options.text: Being able to admit two fingers between the ring and the pessary.

questions.correct_answer: C. Asking the patient to perform the Valsalva maneuver and see if the pessary is in place
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Asking the patient to perform the Valsalva maneuver and see if the pessary is in place

questions.text: A middle-aged man is diagnosed with mucopolysaccharidosis with accumulation of a specific type of glycosaminoglycans, which determines the charge selectiveness of renal glomerular membrane. Which GAG that could be?

Which of the following will be the histopathological findings in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Haphazard arrangement of the myocardial fibers

options.label: B
options.text: Ninja star appearance of the nuclei of cardiac myocytes

options.label: C
options.text: Extracellular amyloid deposition and extensive fibrosis

options.label: D
options.text: Hypertrophy of cardiac myocytes of the interventricular septum

questions.correct_answer: B. Ninja star appearance of the nuclei of cardiac myocytes
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Ninja star appearance of the nuclei of cardiac myocytes

questions.text: A 32-year-old female presents to the gastroenterology clinic with a history of bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramps for the past 2 weeks. She has been experiencing increased frequency of bowel movements with a sense of incomplete evacuation. The patient reports feeling fatigued and has lost a significant amount of weight over the past few months. On examination, the patient appears pale and there is tenderness over the left lower quadrant of the abdomen. A colonoscopy is performed and reveals evidence of inflammation in the mucosal layer of the colon, with friability, erythema, and mucosal ulcerations extending proximally from the rectum. What earliest sign seen on Barium study in the patient?
What can be said about the provided nerve action potential curve is true?

options.label: B
options.text: At point E, the nerve is more excitable

options.label: C
options.text: Point C to D is due to opening of Na+ and closure of K+ channels

options.label: D
options.text: Point B to D is refractory period

questions.correct_answer: D. Point B to D is refractory period
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Point B to D is refractory period

questions.text: Which type of aphasia is seen in the lesions of the posterior part of the superior temporal gyrus?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Fluent aphasia

References:

  • ↳ Reference - KV Krishna Das textbook of Medicine 5th edition

questions.text: Identify the papillae from the given histological section:

A diabetic truck driver presents to you with cough and breathlessness. A diagnosis of pneumonia was confirmed, and histopathological examination revealed dichotomous branching, as shown below. What is the likely causative agent?

A 28-year-old primigravida is in labor. She is presenting with a recurring need to urinate and experiencing premature bearing down. During examination, infra-umbilical flattening is observed, and the fetal heart sounds are heard on the lateral side. What is the most probable presentation/position of the fetus in this case?

A 58-years-old male presented in surgery OPD with perianal pain and recurrent discharge for last 2 years. A diagnosis of fistula-in-ano was made. What is the most common type of fistula in ano according to Parks?
Which among the following is more common in limited cutaneous systemic sclerosis when compared to diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Esophageal dysmotility

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/Rheumatology/ Chap 360

questions.text: In an urban area in the state of Madhya Pradesh, a primigravida goes for institutional delivery after being motivated by an ASHA worker. What are the benefits they will receive (in terms of money in rupees) under the Janani Suraksha Yojana?
questions.correct_answer: A. 1000 for mother and 400 for ASHA
questions.explanation: Ans. A. 1000 for mother and 400 for ASHA

questions.text: A 25-year-old male is diagnosed with duodenal ulcer and exploring surgical options for his treatment. Which of the surgical options listed below has highest patient tolerance in the management of the ulcers?

A 28-year-old primigravida visits the healthcare facility at 36 weeks of gestation, complaining of painful ulcers on her vulva. She denies having experienced any similar lesions in the past. During the examination, multiple painful vesicular lesions are observed. What would be the most appropriate course of treatment for her condition?
questions.correct_answer: A. Acyclovir and elective Cesarean section
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Acyclovir and elective Cesarean section

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with a past history of visceral leishmaniasis presents to the dermatology clinic with multiple hypopigmented macules on his face, arms, and trunk. He reports that the skin lesions began appearing several months after his leishmaniasis was successfully treated. He denies any other associated symptoms, and there is no sensory loss or nerve thickening noted upon examination. A diagnosis of post kala azar dermal leishmaniasis (PKDL) is considered, what is the important differential diagnosis for PKDL among the below options?
Which of the following local anesthetics causes hypertension?
Cancer cells derive nutrition mainly from:

A 35-year-old female presents with concerns about warty lesions on her vulva. Upon examination, numerous warty growths are observed on the vulva and surrounding the anal canal, as shown below. Which condition is most commonly associated with these findings?
All of the following are features of Crohn's disease except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Lead pipe appearance

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/IBD

questions.text: A child visited your OPD with a one-day history of loose stools. During the examination, signs of dehydration were evident, and as a result, the child was administered ORS (oral rehydration solution). This solution aids in glucose absorption by acting through which of the following receptors?
What distention agent is recommended for hysteroscopic polypectomy with bipolar electrocautery for the patient?
What is the most common cause for hospital admission after day care surgery?
What is the maximum period of voluntary self-admission under the Mental Healthcare Act 2017?
According to the berlin definition, moderate ARDS is characterized by all, except:

You are currently evaluating a multigravida in the second stage of labor, which has been ongoing for the last two hours. During examination, it is noted that contractions are sufficient, and the cervix is fully dilated. The fetal head is at station 0, with moderate molding (2+) and a noticeable swelling on the presenting part (caput) of the head (2+). The sagittal suture is in the right occipito-transverse position. Additionally, the fetal heart rate is recorded 140 beats per minute. Based on this assessment, what course of action should be taken for the management of this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Wait for an hour for spontaneous labor

questions.text: A 35-year-old female patient presents to the ophthalmology clinic with complaints of sudden onset eye redness, irritation, and excessive tearing in both eyes for 2 days. On examination, bilateral conjunctival injection and subconjunctival hemorrhages are noted. The ophthalmologist suspects acute hemorrhagic conjunctivitis. What is the cause of acute hemorrhagic conjunctivitis?
A 25-year-old male patient was prescribed Haloperidol following which he developed bradykinesia, rigidity and resting tremors. Which of the following drugs can be given to control these symptoms?

A 42-year-old male patient is brought to the OPD with the complaints of irritable mood, sudden outbursts of anger, uncontrolled jerky movements of the face, arms and upper body. On examination, the reflexes are brisk and there is increased muscle tone. The patient died a few days later and his autopsy was done. The gross coronal image of his brain is shown below. Which of the following statements is not true regarding the diagnosis of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: It is an autosomal dominant neurodegenerative disorder

options.label: B
options.text: It occurs due to the trinucleotide repeats of CAG

options.label: C
options.text: It is characterized by reduced Acetylcholine and increased dopamine levels

options.label: D
options.text: Histopathological examination reveals characteristic Lewy bodies

questions.correct_answer: D. Histopathological examination reveals characteristic Lewy bodies
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Histopathological examination reveals characteristic Lewy bodies

questions.text: Which contraceptive option would be most suitable for a 24-year-old lactating woman with an 18-month-old child experiencing irregular and heavy bleeding?
A patient develops prosthetic valve endocarditis 2 years after valve replacement surgery. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause?
Which theory explains primary acquired cholesteatoma?
What is the probable diagnosis for a patient with a midline neck swelling and histopathological findings of Orphan Annie eye nuclei on biopsy as shown below?
From which of the following structures does the labelled A in the provided image originate?

A 30-year-old male has presented to the OPD with the complaints of easy bruising and recurrent and prolonged bleeding after a minor trauma. He was diagnosed with Glanzmann thrombasthenia. For coagulation studies, which of the following vacutainers will you use to send the plasma sample?
A patient with damage to basilar membrane presented with low frequency hearing loss. Where is the location of most likely lesion?
Match the following drugs based on their mechanism of causing ototoxicity.

The Government of India noticed a concerning trend of incomplete immunization coverage among children, leading to preventable diseases and health risks. In response, they launched a significant initiative to address this issue and ensure the complete immunization of children across the country. Which of the following initiatives was launched by the Government of India to achieve the objective of complete immunization of children?
A 30-year-old HIV-positive man presents with fever for 3 weeks, dry cough, and significant weight loss. His HRCT thorax is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/HIV/Opportunistic Infection in HIV/Chap

questions.text: A 65-year-old male experienced a stroke 48 hours ago, and he currently exhibits involuntary, forceful, and flinging movements of the limbs on one side of his body. Where is the probable location of the lesion in this patient?
All of the following are AIDS defining illnesses except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Oral Candidiasis

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/Infectious Disease/Chap 202

questions.text: The time required for preoxygenation before tracheal intubation?
A child who is a victim under POCSO act is brought to the department of forensic medicine for age estimation. The X-ray image of the hand is shown below. What is the likely age of the child?
A newborn is noted to have a continuous "machine-like" murmur heard best beneath the left clavicle. Which congenital heart defect should be suspected?
Identical twins have similarities in all of the following except:

A 28-year-old male has recently returned from mountains. He reports that he was bitten by some insect. A few days later he developed fever, malaise and a black eschar on the site of the bite. The image of his hand is shown below. Which of the following drugs should be prescribed to the patient?
Which of the following patients comes under the category III non-heart-beating donor?

options.label: A
options.text: A patient who died during transportation to the hospital

options.label: B
options.text: A patient who died after failed resuscitation after reaching the hospital

options.label: C
options.text: A patient who was brought dead to the hospital

options.label: D
options.text: A patient who is awaiting death in the hospital

questions.correct_answer: D. A patient who is awaiting death in the hospital
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. A patient who is awaiting death in the hospital

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison 21/Renal transplantation/Table 313-1.

questions.text: Image Description: An MRI of an infant's brain showing periventricular leukomalacia (PVL) with areas of cystic necrosis. Question: What is the most likely cause of the brain abnormalities seen in the image?

A 25-year-old female has presented to the OPD with the complaints of diplopia, drooping of the eyelids. Her HRCT was done which reveals a mediastinal mass. Which of the following statements regarding the diagnosis of the patient is NOT true?

options.label: A
options.text: The most likely tumour she has is Thymoma

options.label: B
options.text: It is also associated with reduced levels of immunoglobulins

options.label: C
options.text: Her symptoms of diplopia and drooping of eyelids are due to autoantibodies against ACh receptors.

options.label: D
options.text: Her symptoms of diplopia and drooping of eyelids are due to autoantibodies against Calcium channels.

questions.correct_answer: D. Her symptoms of diplopia and drooping of eyelids are due to autoantibodies against Calcium channels.
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Her symptoms of diplopia and drooping of eyelids are due to autoantibodies against Calcium channels

questions.text: All of the following are indications for BRCA testing except?

options.label: C
options.text: Breast cancer in a 54-year-old post-menopausal female

questions.correct_answer: C. Breast cancer in a 54-year-old post-menopausal female
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Breast cancer in a 54-year-old post-menopausal female

questions.text: A 58-year-old male patient has been diagnosed with hypertension. On examination, there is no existing cardiovascular disease, no hypertension-mediated organ damage (HMOD), and the renal function is normal. He should be immediately started on pharmacological management if his blood pressure is more than:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. > 160/100 mmHg

References:

  • ↳ Reference: ISH2020, AHA2017 HTN guidelines

questions.text: In the fracture shown in the X-ray below, what is the most commonly expected vascular injury?
Among the listed drugs, which one is a monoclonal antibody used in cancer treatment?
A 54 years male patient presented with a chief complaint of swelling bulging of veins in the lower limbs as shown in the image. What is the gold standard treatment for this condition?

A 55-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a history of fever and excessive sweating for the past 2 days. He is diagnosed with a systemic bacterial infection, likely of unknown origin. His hypothalamic thermostat has been reset from the normal point A to a new point C, resulting in a higher set point for body temperature. Which of the following happens in stage W compared to stage Y?
In the waste disposal process, which bin should be used to dispose of a blood bag?

A 2 days old baby presents with tachypnoea, nasal flaring, grunting, and intercostal retractions. Chest X-ray reveals diffuse ground-glass opacities (white out lung) & hyperinflation. Which respiratory disorder is the most likely diagnosis?
Arrange the sample sizes of samples 1, 2, and 3 in the order of their margin of error?

A 10-year-old boy complains of multiple episodes of acute severe pain in his fingers and toes which resolves on its own for the past 1 year. Which of the following conditions is he most likely suffering from?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Sickle cell anemia

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison 21 /Hemoglobinopathies/Chapter 98

questions.text: A 60-year-old female has recently undergone total thyroidectomy for a thyroid mass. The histopathological examination shows papillary thyroid cancer. What would be the further management of this patient?

A 25-year-old male patient presents with a midline swelling in the neck. Upon examination, cervical node enlargement is also observed. Histopathological analysis of the lesion reveals the following. Which of the following statements is false regarding the same?

options.label: A
options.text: Excellent prognosis is associated with this condition.

options.label: C
options.text: Nuclear characteristics are used for identification.

options.label: D
options.text: Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) is not diagnostic.

questions.correct_answer: D. Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) is not diagnostic.
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) is not diagnostic.

questions.text: You are a healthcare professional reviewing the recommendations proposed by the Chaddah committee, a panel assigned by the government to improve healthcare services in the region. As you carefully examine their suggestions, please identify the recommendation that the committee did NOT include in their proposal:

options.label: A
options.text: The Chaddah committee recommended establishing Primary Health Centers (PHC) at the block level to ensure better healthcare coverage in rural areas.

options.label: B
options.text: Another significant recommendation was to have one PHC available for every 50,000 population, which aimed to ensure adequate healthcare facilities in different regions.

options.label: C
options.text: Additionally, the committee proposed allocating one basic health worker for every 10,000 population, intending to address the healthcare needs of communities more effectively.

options.label: D
options.text: Assigning the responsibility of PHCs in malaria eradication as part of their proposed measures to enhance healthcare services.

questions.correct_answer: B. Another significant recommendation was to have one PHC available for every 50,000 population, which aimed to ensure adequate healthcare facilities in different regions.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Another significant recommendation was to have one PHC available for every 50,000 population, which aimed to ensure adequate healthcare facilities in different regions.

questions.text: A 35-year-old female patient has hypokalemia, hypertension and metabolic alkalosis. What is the most likely etiology?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Liddle’s Syndrome

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison 21E/ Physiology of Kidney/Chap 309 - Table 309-1

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy is brought to the hospital with symptoms of an inguinal hernia. During the operation, the surgeon observes a segment of necrotic bowel in the hernial sac. What is the appropriate course of action for resection and anastomosis of a necrotic bowel seen during surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: The surgeon must use chromic catgut.

options.label: B
options.text: The surgeon must not include the submucosa in the sutures.

options.label: C
options.text: The surgeon must use the single layer, extra-mucosal suture technique.

options.label: D
options.text: The surgeon must use the single- layer seromuscular suture technique.

questions.correct_answer: C. The surgeon must use the single layer, extra-mucosal suture technique.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. The surgeon must use the single layer, extra-mucosal suture technique.

questions.text: Multiple abscesses with discharging sinuses, demonstrating sulphur granules in pus, are caused by?
Ch o o s e the correct order of steps of disaster management?
questions.correct_answer: B. Disaster impact - Response- Rehabilitation - Mitigation
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Disaster impact - Response- Rehabilitation - Mitigation

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is indicated in management of Torsades de Pointes?
A 45-year-old man from Bihar presents with fever, hepatomegaly, splenomegaly. Peripheral smear shown in image. What is the vector for the condition diagnosed by the image shown below?

In a bustling city with a rapidly growing population, concerns about air pollution have become increasingly prevalent. The local authorities have decided to implement routine monitoring of air quality to understand the extent of the problem and take appropriate measures to safeguard public health. Which of the following is the best indicators for routine monitoring of air pollution?

options.label: A
options.text: Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

options.label: B
options.text: Sulfur dioxide, lead, and particulate matter

questions.correct_answer: A. Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

questions.text: A 40-year-old male patient came to ED with complaints of weakness, paresthesia, and breathing difficulty. Relevant investigations were done. The ECG obtained is suggestive of:
Which of these is not a factor affecting wound healing?

A 2-year-old female child was brought by her parents with delayed developmental milestones and pain in lower limbs and difficulty in walking for 3 months. O/E: child had stiffness of joints in both upper and lower limbs and has coarse facial features, low IQ and hepatomegaly. Urinary examination: presence of heparan sulphate and dermatan sulphate; fibroblast study: Deficiency of enzyme iduronate-2-sulfatase. What is your diagnosis?

A 65-year-old postmenopausal female patient with a history of Colle's fracture presented with lower back pain. After assessment, Her T score was -2.5. Which of the following statements regarding the management of her condition is false?

options.label: A
options.text: After using Teriparatide the patient should be supplemented with bisphosphonates

options.label: B
options.text: Bisphosphonates are not given for more than a year

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium requirement is 1200 mg per day

options.label: D
options.text: Oral vitamin D3 is given along with oral calcium

questions.correct_answer: B. Bisphosphonates are not given for more than a year
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Bisphosphonates are not given for more than a year

questions.text: Bacterial transduction occurs by?

options.label: D
options.text: Uptake of genetic material by other bacteria.
